cm.fwi.dao

Class Pool

  • java.lang.Object
    • cm.fwi.dao.Pool

  • public class Pool
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeConnections()
      This method clause all connections of the Pool's instace and clear both the states and connections lists.
      void deliverConnection(java.sql.Connection connection)
      Deliver a connection of the pooling (unique instance of Pool) by setting its state from busy(false) to free(true).
      java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      This method return the first free (true state) connection of the pooling connection (unique instance of Pool) and set the state of this connection to busy(false in the state list).
      static Pool getInstance(java.lang.String url, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String password)
      This method create the unique instance of Pool if is not yet done.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Pool getInstance(java.lang.String url,
                               java.lang.String user,
                               java.lang.String password)
                        throws PoolException
        This method create the unique instance of Pool if is not yet done.
        Parameters:
        url - to the database
        user - user name to used for the connection to the database
        password - of the user to used for the connection to the database
        Returns:
        the unique instance of Pool.
        Throws:
        PoolException - when errors occur during the connections establishment.

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                  throws PoolException
        This method return the first free (true state) connection of the pooling connection (unique instance of Pool) and set the state of this connection to busy(false in the state list).
        Returns:
        return the first free connection of the pooling
        Throws:
        PoolException - when there is no free connection (connection with true's state)

      • deliverConnection

        public void deliverConnection(java.sql.Connection connection)
                       throws PoolException
        Deliver a connection of the pooling (unique instance of Pool) by setting its state from busy(false) to free(true).
        Parameters:
        connection - that wants to be deliver
        Throws:
        PoolException - when the deliver's connection does not exist in the pooling connection (ie. amoung the list of connection of the Pool's instance).

      • closeConnections

        public void closeConnections()
                      throws PoolException
        This method clause all connections of the Pool's instace and clear both the states and connections lists.
        Throws:
        PoolException - is throws when the process fail to close a connection.
